doc.previous: Author C J Stevens wrote The Supernatural Side of Maine a 2002 book about witches and people from Maine who faced the supernatural
doc.after: Witchcraft was also an important part of the social and cultural history of late Colonial Mexico Spanish Inquisitors viewed witchcraft as a problem that could be cured simply through confession Yet as anthropologist Ruth Behar writes witchcraft not only in Mexico but in Latin America in general was a conjecture of sexuality witchcraft and religion in which Spanish indigenous and African cultures converged 113 Furthermore witchcraft in Mexico generally required an interethnic and interclass network of witches 114 Yet according to anthropology professor Laura Lewis witchcraft in colonial Mexico ultimately represented an affirmation of hegemony for women Indians and especially Indian women over their white male counterparts as a result of the casta system 115
